thread.title: To do this 3-day weekend: Honor MLK, take a parents’ night out, plus burlesque to check out
thread.title_full: To do this 3-day weekend: Honor MLK, take a parents’ night out, plus burlesque to check out

author: Juan Betancourt Staff Writer
title: To do this 3-day weekend: Honor MLK, take a parents’ night out, plus burlesque to check out
text:
It won't be as cold as next week's expected temperatures this weekend, but we're still feeling the Texas winter chill, so make sure to bring warm layers if you plan to go out during the weekend.
Don't forget, it’s also a three-day weekend for most offices, including the city of Denton, in honor of Martin Luther King Jr. Day on Monday.
Locals can attend the final event in Denton’s Quakertown Centennial memorial program, watch a burlesque show at Andersons Eatery and Distillery, and attend the city's Martin Luther King Jr. Day Celebration at the MLK Jr. Recreation Center.
Friday
Kids Rock and Parents' Night Out
Where: Denton Civic Center, 321 E. McKinney St.
When: 7 to 11 p.m.
Tickets: $25 for residents. $35 for non-residents.
Each month, kids can enjoy a night out while parents enjoy the night off. Denton Parks and Recreation staff plan each month around a unique theme with activities, mini-sports tournaments, video games on a large screen and more.
Live music at Rubber Gloves
Where: Rubber Gloves Rehearsal Studios, 411 E. Sycamore St.
When: 7 p.m. to midnight
https://rubberglovesdenton.com/events/poftx-presentsthe-spits-die-spitz/: $20
The lineup includes punk rockers the SPITS, all-female rockers Die Spitz and
Denton locals Laughing Matter. Can't make Friday? Check out more bands throughout the weekend on Saturday and Sunday.
Live music at Dan's Silverleaf
Where: Dan’s Silverleaf, 103 Industrial St.
When: 9 p.m.
https://www.prekindle.com/promo/id/532452770973553496: $12 in advance. $15 at the door.
For a different vibe with more classic country roots, Friday’s lineup includes San Antonio-based rockabilly band,
Two Tons Of Steel. Check out the rest of Dan’s Silverleaf weekend shows, too.
Saturday
Sensory-friendly morning at Explorium
Where: Explorium Denton Children's Museum, 5800 N. Interstate 35, 214
When: 9 to 10 a.m.
Children with sensory-friendly needs can visit the Explorium museum when the museum is less crowded and noisy. Staff will alter light levels and display volumes for visiting hours.
Quakertown Speaks: Hear from the descendants
Where: Denton Civic Center, 321 E. McKinney St.
When: 10 a.m., beginning at the MLK Jr. Rec Center for a procession to the Civic Center
The Quakertown Speaks event will be the final event in Denton’s Quakertown Centennial Memorial program. The event will give Quakertown descendants an opportunity to share the meaning of Quakertown's history with the wider Denton community.
The event will feature a roundtable discussion and music. The Rev. Reginald Logan will serve as the event emcee.
UNT men’s basketball vs. Temple
Where: UNT Coliseum/Super Pit, 801 N. Texas Blvd.
When: 5 p.m. tip-off
https://meangreensports.evenue.net/cgi-bin/ncommerce3/SEGetEventInfo?ticketCode=GS%3AATHLETICS%3AMB23%3AMB08%3A&linkID=unt-athletics&shopperContext=&pc=&caller=&appCode=&groupCode=MBSING&cgc=&dataAccId=668&locale=en_US&siteId=ev_unt-athletics: $15-$20
The Mean Green men's basketball team is getting further into American Athletic Conference play against Temple University. Head to the Super Pit to cheer on the reigning NIT champions for a reasonably priced activity (especially for students and kids).
Live jazz at Black Fox Brewing Company
Where: Black Fox Brewing Company, 205 N. Cedar St.
When: 7 to 9 p.m.
At Denton's newest local brewery, enjoy some craft brews and some jazz provided by the Beauty Industry.
Burlesque show at Andersons
Where: Andersons Eatery and Distillery, 410 North Bell Avenue
When: 9 p.m. to 1:30 a.m.
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/andersons-burlesque-show-tickets-789504949557?aff=ebdssbdestsearch&fbclid=IwAR1q4XkKpb8APOjSHrRNKC_GCwF6fLBkE82dOwe1_Zt3A3vr0oowVRVylyc: Starts at $20 for general admission
Check out the new Andersons distillery space with a swanky night featuring local burlesque performers, Birdie Holly, Mulan Alexander, Onyx Fury and Vivienne Vermuth.
Sunday
UNT women's basketball vs. Wichita State
Where: UNT Coliseum/Super Pit, 801 N. Texas Blvd.
When: 2 p.m. tip-off
(Varies:%20https://meangreensports.evenue.net/cgi-bin/ncommerce3/SEGetEventInfo?ticketCode=GS%3AATHLETICS%3AWB23%3AWB08%3A&linkID=unt-athletics&shopperContext=&pc=&caller=&appCode=&groupCode=WBSING&cgc=&dataAccId=668&locale=en_US&siteId=ev_unt-athletics): Varies
The UNT women's basketball team is bringing their
hot streak and historic start to the season to the home court. The Mean Green face Wichita State University on Sunday.
Monday
Where: Martin Luther King Jr. Recreation Center, 1300 Wilson St.
When: 3 to 6 p.m.
Denton Parks and Rec is hosting the “Living the Dream: It Starts With Me — Spreading Hope, Courage and Unity” event to commemorate the birthday of American civil rights leader Martin Luther King Jr.
The full-day events will start with a flag football tournament at 11 a.m., community members will meet at Fred Moore Park to march to the Martin Luther King Jr. Recreation Center, followed by the main program.
